𝒙t=𝒙t−1−η~​𝒰​(1S​∑i∇fi​(𝒙)+𝒆t;𝒔t−1),superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂𝒰1𝑆subscript𝑖∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙superscript𝒆𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\bm{x}^{t}=\bm{x}^{t-1}-\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})+\hbox{\pagecolor{myred!30}\text{$\bm{e}^{t}$}};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)\,,

for η~:=K​ηassign~𝜂𝐾𝜂\tilde{\eta}:=K\eta and 𝐞t=1K​S​∑i,k(∇fi​(𝐲i,k−1;ζi,k)−∇fi​(𝐱;ζi,k))superscript𝐞𝑡1𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖𝑘1subscript𝜁𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝐱subscript𝜁𝑖𝑘\hbox{\pagecolor{myred!30}\text{$\bm{e}^{t}$}}=\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k})).

Proof.

Because the updater 𝒰𝒰\mathcal{U} is linear in its first parameter, we can rewrite the update to the server for MimeLite as

𝒙t−𝒙t−1superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝒙𝑡1\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1} =1S​∑i∈𝒮t∑k=1K−η​𝒰​(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt);𝒔t−1)absent1𝑆subscript𝑖superscript𝒮𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾𝜂𝒰∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscriptsuperscript𝒚𝑡𝑖𝑘1subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1})
=η​K​𝒰​(1K​S​∑i,k∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt);𝒔t−1)absent𝜂𝐾𝒰1𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscriptsuperscript𝒚𝑡𝑖𝑘1subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)

We drop the dependence on t𝑡t when obvious from context and i𝑖i by default sums over 𝒮tsuperscript𝒮𝑡\mathcal{S}^{t} and k𝑘k over [K]delimited-[]𝐾[K] by default. Since K𝐾K represents a multiple of epochs, we have ∑k∇fi​(𝒙;ζi,kt)=K​∇fi​(𝒙)subscript𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘𝐾∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙\sum_{k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})=K\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}). Continuing,

𝒙t−𝒙t−1superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝒙𝑡1\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1} =η​K​𝒰​(1K​S​∑i,k∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt);𝒔t−1)absent𝜂𝐾𝒰1𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscriptsuperscript𝒚𝑡𝑖𝑘1subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)
=η~​𝒰​(1S​∑i∇fi​(𝒙)+𝒆t;𝒔t−1)absent~𝜂𝒰1𝑆subscript𝑖∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙superscript𝒆𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)

where

𝒆t=1K​S​∑i,k(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,k)−∇fi​(𝒙;ζi,k))superscript𝒆𝑡1𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1subscript𝜁𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙subscript𝜁𝑖𝑘\bm{e}^{t}=\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}))

Now let us examine the update of Mime. Again assuming K𝐾K is a multiple of epoch, we have ∑i,k∇fi​(𝒙;ζi,kt)=K​∑i∇fi​(𝒙)=K​S​𝒙subscript𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘𝐾subscript𝑖∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙𝐾𝑆𝒙\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})=K\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})=KS\bm{x}. Hence,

𝒙t−𝒙t−1superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝒙𝑡1\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1} =1S​∑i∈𝒮t∑k=1K−η​𝒰​(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,kt)−∇fi​(𝒙;ζi,kt)+𝒄;𝒔t−1)absent1𝑆subscript𝑖superscript𝒮𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾𝜂𝒰∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘𝒄superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\sum_{k=1}^{K}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta^{t}_{i,k})+\bm{c};\bm{s}^{t-1})
=η​K​𝒰​(1K​S​∑i,k∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt);𝒔t−1)absent𝜂𝐾𝒰1𝐾𝑆subscript𝑖𝑘∇subscript𝑓𝑖subscriptsuperscript𝒚𝑡𝑖𝑘1subscriptsuperscript𝜁𝑡𝑖𝑘superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}^{t}_{i,k-1};\zeta^{t}_{i,k});\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)
=η​K​𝒰​(1S​∑i∇fi​(𝒙)+𝒆t;𝒔t−1).absent𝜂𝐾𝒰1𝑆subscript𝑖∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙superscript𝒆𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\eta K\mathcal{U}\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)\,.

Thus we showed the lemma for both Mime and MimeLite. ∎

Lemma 6 (Defining error).

For 𝐞tsuperscript𝐞𝑡\bm{e}^{t} defined in Lemma 5, assuming all functions fi​(⋅,ζ)subscript𝑓𝑖⋅𝜁f_{i}(\,\cdot\,,\zeta) are L𝐿L-smooth, we have

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2≤L21K​S∑i,k𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2⏟=⁣:ℰKt.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq L^{2}\underbrace{\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}}_{=:\mathcal{E}_{K}^{t}}\,.
Proof.

Using the smoothness of the individual functions and the definition of 𝒆tsuperscript𝒆𝑡\bm{e}^{t},

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2} =𝔼∥1K​S∑i,k(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,k)−∇fi(𝒙;ζi,k))∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}))\rVert^{2}
≤1K​S∑i,k𝔼∥∇fi(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,k)−∇fi(𝒙;ζi,k)∥2≤L2ℰKt.\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k})\rVert^{2}\leq L^{2}\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\,.

∎

Henceforth, we will call ℰKtsubscriptsuperscriptℰ𝑡𝐾\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K} as the error, or as the client-drift following [30].

Bounding error in MimeLite.

Now we will try bound the client drift ℰtsuperscriptℰ𝑡\mathcal{E}^{t} for MimeLite.

Lemma 7 (MimeLite error).

Suppose that all functions fi​(⋅,ζ)subscript𝑓𝑖⋅𝜁f_{i}(\,\cdot\,,\zeta) are L𝐿L-smooth ((A2*)), σ2superscript𝜎2\sigma^{2} variance ((A3)), and ((A1)) is satisfied, and the updater 𝒰𝒰\mathcal{U} has B𝐵B-Lipschitz updates. Then using step-size η~≤12​B​L~𝜂12𝐵𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2BL},

118​B2​η~2ℰK≤𝔼∥∇f(𝒙)∥2+G2+σ22​K.\frac{1}{18B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}}\mathcal{E}^{K}\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+G^{2}+\frac{\sigma^{2}}{2K}\,.
Proof.

For K=1𝐾1K=1, we have 𝔼∥𝒚i,1−𝒙∥2≤B2η2(G2+σ2)+B2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙)∥2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}\leq B^{2}\eta^{2}(G^{2}+\sigma^{2})+B^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}. The lemma is easily shown to be true. Assuming K≥2𝐾2K\geq 2 henceforth, and starting from the client update of MimeLite we have

𝔼∥𝒚i,k−𝒙∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} =𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−η𝒰(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt);𝒔t−1)−𝒙∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t});\bm{s}^{t-1})-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−η𝒰(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1t;𝒔t−1)−𝒙∥2+B2η2σ2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
≤(1+1K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+Kη2𝔼∥𝒰(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1t;𝒔t−1)∥2+B2η2σ2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
≤(1+1K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+KB2η2𝔼∥∇fi(𝒚i,k−1)±∇fi(𝒙)∥2+B2η2σ2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1})\pm\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
≤(1+1K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
+2KB2η2𝔼∥∇fi(𝒙)∥2+2KB2L2η2𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+B2η2σ2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}L^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}
≤(1+2K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+2KB2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙)∥2+2KB2η2G2+B2η2σ2.\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}G^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\,.

Here, we used the condition on our step size that η~=K​η≤12​L​B~𝜂𝐾𝜂12𝐿𝐵\tilde{\eta}=K\eta\leq\frac{1}{2LB}, which implies that 2​K​B2​L2​η2≤1K−12𝐾superscript𝐵2superscript𝐿2superscript𝜂21𝐾12KB^{2}L^{2}\eta^{2}\leq\frac{1}{K-1}. Unrolling this recursion, we have

𝔼∥𝒚i,k−𝒙∥2≤(2KB2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙)∥2+2KB2η2G2+B2η2σ2)∑k=1K(1+2K−1)k.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}\leq\left(2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+2KB^{2}\eta^{2}G^{2}+B^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\right)\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\,.

Note that (1+2K−1)k≤9superscript12𝐾1𝑘9\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\leq 9. Averaging then over k𝑘k and i𝑖i, we get

ℰKt≤18K2B2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙)∥2+18K2B2η2G2+9KB2η2σ2.\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18K^{2}B^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x})\rVert^{2}+18K^{2}B^{2}\eta^{2}G^{2}+9KB^{2}\eta^{2}\sigma^{2}\,.

Finally, recalling that η~=K​η~𝜂𝐾𝜂\tilde{\eta}=K\eta finishes the lemma. ∎

Bounding error in Mime.

Next we will try bound the client drift ℰtsuperscriptℰ𝑡\mathcal{E}^{t} for Mime. The additional SVRG correction term used in Mime improves the bound on the error.

Lemma 8 (Mime Error).

Suppose that all functions fi​(⋅,ζ)subscript𝑓𝑖⋅𝜁f_{i}(\,\cdot\,,\zeta) are L𝐿L-smooth ((A2*)), σ2superscript𝜎2\sigma^{2} variance ((A3)), and ((A1)) is satisfied, and the updater 𝒰𝒰\mathcal{U} has B𝐵B-Lipschitz updates. Then using step-size η~≤12​B​L~𝜂12𝐵𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2BL},

ℰK≤18B2η~2𝔼∥1S∑i∇if(𝒙)∥2.\mathcal{E}^{K}\leq 18B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla_{i}f(\bm{x})\right\rVert^{2}\,.
Proof.

For K=1𝐾1K=1, the Mime update loos like

𝔼∥𝒚i,1−𝒙∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} =η2𝔼∥𝒰(𝒄;𝒔t−1)∥2\displaystyle=\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c};\bm{s}^{t-1}\right)\rVert^{2}
≤η2B2𝔼∥𝒄∥2.\displaystyle\leq\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}\rVert^{2}\,.

Assuming K≥2𝐾2K\geq 2 henceforth, and starting from the client update of Mime we have

𝔼∥𝒚i,k−𝒙∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2} =𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−η𝒰(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,kt)−∇fi(𝒙;ζi,kt)+𝒄t;𝒔t−1)−𝒙∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\eta\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+1K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
+Kη2𝔼∥𝒰(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,kt)−∇fi(𝒙;ζi,kt)+𝒄t;𝒔t−1)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
≤(1+1K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+Kη2B2𝔼∥∇fi(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,kt)−∇fi(𝒙;ζi,kt)+𝒄t∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+1K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}
+2Kη2B2𝔼∥∇fi(𝒚i,k−1;ζi,kt)−∇fi(𝒙;ζi,kt)∥2+2Kη2B2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})\rVert^{2}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+1K−1+2Kη2B2L2)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+2Kη2B2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K-1}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}L^{2}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+2K−1)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1−𝒙∥2+2Kη2B2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2.\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2K\eta^{2}B^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

Here, we used the condition on our step size that η~=K​η≤12​L​B~𝜂𝐾𝜂12𝐿𝐵\tilde{\eta}=K\eta\leq\frac{1}{2LB}, which implies that 2​K​B2​L2​η2≤1K−12𝐾superscript𝐵2superscript𝐿2superscript𝜂21𝐾12KB^{2}L^{2}\eta^{2}\leq\frac{1}{K-1}. Unrolling this recursion, we have

𝔼∥𝒚i,k−𝒙∥2≤2KB2η2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2∑k=1K(1+2K−1)k≤18K2B2η2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}\leq 2KB^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\leq 18K^{2}B^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

Note that (1+2K−1)k≤9superscript12𝐾1𝑘9\left(1+\frac{2}{K-1}\right)^{k}\leq 9. Averaging then over k𝑘k and i𝑖i, recalling that η~=K​η~𝜂𝐾𝜂\tilde{\eta}=K\eta get

ℰKt≤18B2η~2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2.\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

∎

Putting it together (Theorem I).
Lemma 9.

The updates of Mime and MimeLite for 𝐜tsuperscript𝐜𝑡\bm{c}^{t} satisfying 𝔼[𝐜t]=∇f(𝐱t−1) and 𝔼∥𝐜t−∇f(𝐱t−1)∥2≤G2S\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}[\bm{c}^{t}]=\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\text{ and }\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{G^{2}}{S}, we have for η~≤12​B​L~𝜂12𝐵𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2BL}

𝒙tsuperscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t} =𝒙t−1−η~​𝒰​(𝒄t+𝒆t;𝒔t−1)absentsuperscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂𝒰superscript𝒄𝑡superscript𝒆𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\bm{x}^{t-1}-\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})
𝒔tsuperscript𝒔𝑡\displaystyle\bm{s}^{t} =𝒱​(𝒄t;𝒔t−1).absent𝒱superscript𝒄𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\mathcal{V}(\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\,.

Where, we have

118​B2​L2​η~2𝔼t∥𝒆t∥2≤{𝔼∥𝒄t∥2Mime ,𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t)∥2+G2+σ22​KMimeLite.\tfrac{1}{18B^{2}L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{t}\lVert\text{\hbox{\pagecolor{myred!30}$\bm{e}_{t}$}}\rVert^{2}\leq\begin{cases}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}_{t}\rVert^{2}&\text{\hbox{\pagecolor{myblue!30}{\sc Mime}}\,,}\\ \operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t})\rVert^{2}+G^{2}+\frac{\sigma^{2}}{2K}&\text{\hbox{\pagecolor{mygreen!30}{\sc MimeLite}}.}\end{cases}
Proof.

Now, combining Lemmas 5, 6, shows that running Mime or MimeLite is equivalent to

𝒙tsuperscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\bm{x}^{t} =𝒙t−1−η~​𝒰​(𝒄t+𝒆t;𝒔t−1)absentsuperscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂𝒰superscript𝒄𝑡superscript𝒆𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\bm{x}^{t-1}-\tilde{\eta}\mathcal{U}(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})
𝒔tsuperscript𝒔𝑡\displaystyle\bm{s}^{t} =𝒱​(𝒄t;𝒔t−1),absent𝒱superscript𝒄𝑡superscript𝒔𝑡1\displaystyle=\mathcal{V}(\bm{c}^{t};\bm{s}^{t-1})\,,

where

𝔼[𝒄t]=∇f(𝒙t−1) and 𝔼∥𝒄t−∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2≤G2S.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}[\bm{c}^{t}]=\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\text{ and }\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{G^{2}}{S}\,.

This shows the first part of the theorem. For the second part of the theorem, using the bound from Lemma 8 for Mime,

𝔼∥𝒆t∥≤L2ℰKt≤18L2B2η~2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert\leq L^{2}\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

For MimeLite, we will instead use the bound from Lemma 7,

𝔼∥𝒆t∥≤L2ℰKt≤18L2B2η~2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t)∥2+18L2B2η~2G2+9​L2​B2​η~2​σ2K.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert\leq L^{2}\mathcal{E}^{t}_{K}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t})\rVert^{2}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}+\frac{9L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{K}\,.

∎

Note that the Lemma we proved here is slightly stronger than the theorem in the main section (up to constants which were suppressed).

F.2 Convergence of MimeSGD and MimeLiteSGD (Corollary II)

Theorem I shows that Mime and MimeLite mimic a centralized algorithm quite closely up to error 𝒪​(η~2)𝒪superscript~𝜂2\mathcal{O}(\tilde{\eta}^{2}). Then, analyzing the sensitivity of the base algorithm to such perturbation yields specific rates of convergence. We perform such an analysis using SGD as our base optimizer.

Properties of SGD as the base optimizer:

  • •

    𝒔tsuperscript𝒔𝑡\bm{s}^{t} is empty i.e. there are no global statistics used.

  • •

    𝒰​(𝒈;𝒔t−1)=𝒈𝒰𝒈superscript𝒔𝑡1𝒈\mathcal{U}(\bm{g};\bm{s}^{t-1})=\bm{g} for any 𝒈𝒈\bm{g} and B=1𝐵1B=1.

With this in mind, we proceed.

Lemma 10 (Progress in one round).

Given that f𝑓f is L𝐿L-smooth, and for any step-size η~≤12​(B+2)​L~𝜂12𝐵2𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{2(B+2)L} for B≥1𝐵1B\geq 1 we have

f(𝒙t)≤f(𝒙t−1)−η~4𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+L​η~2​G2S.f(\bm{x}^{t})\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

Starting from the update equation and the smoothness of f𝑓f, we have

𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t)𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) ≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)+𝔼⟨∇f(𝒙t−1),𝒙t−𝒙t−1⟩+L2𝔼∥𝒙t−𝒙t−1∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rangle+\frac{L}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
=𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~⟨∇f(𝒙t−1),𝒆t⟩+L​η~22𝔼∥𝒄t+𝒆t∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\tilde{\eta}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\bm{e}^{t}\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~2∥𝒆t∥2+2​L​η~22𝔼∥𝒄t∥2+2​L​η~22𝔼∥𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−(η~2−2​L​η~22)𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+(Lη~2+η~2)𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+2​L​η~2​G22​S.\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}-\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\left(L\tilde{\eta}^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{2S}\,.

Using the bound on the step size that η~≤14​L~𝜂14𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{4L} yields the lemma. ∎

One round progress for MimeSGD.

Next, we specialize the convergence rate for Mime.

Lemma 11.

Suppose f𝑓f is a L𝐿L-smooth function satisfying PL-inequality for μ≥0𝜇0\mu\geq 0 (μ=0𝜇0\mu=0 corresponds to the general case). Running MimeSGD for η~≤112​B​L~𝜂112𝐵𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12BL} satisfies

η~16𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2≤(1−μ​η~8)(f(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)−(f(𝒙t)−f⋆)+3​L​η~2​G2S.\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})+\frac{3L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

Recall from Lemma 9 that for Mime,

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2≤18L2B2η~2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2≤18L2B2η~2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+18​L2​B2​η~2​G2S.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Combining this with Lemma 10 yields the following progress for Mime

f​(𝒙t)𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t}) ≤f(𝒙t−1)−(η~4−18L2B2η~3)𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+(L​η~2+18​L2​B2​η~3)​G2S\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4}-18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{(L\tilde{\eta}^{2}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3})G^{2}}{S}
≤f(𝒙t−1)−η~8𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+3​L​η~2​G2S.\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Here, we used the bound on the step size that η~≤112​L​B~𝜂112𝐿𝐵\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12LB} implies 18​L2​B2​η~2≤1818superscript𝐿2superscript𝐵2superscript~𝜂21818L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\leq\frac{1}{8}. Now using PL-inequality, we can write

f​(𝒙t)−f⋆𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝑓⋆\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star} ≤f(𝒙t−1)−f⋆−μ​η~8(f(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)−η~16𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+3​L​η~2​G2S.\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star}-\frac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8}(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

This yields the lemma. ∎

We are now ready to derive the convergence rate.

Convergence rate of MimeSGD on general non-convex functions.

Set μ=0𝜇0\mu=0 in Lemma 11 and sum over t𝑡t

1T∑t=1T𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} ≤16​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η~​T+48​L​η~​G2Sabsent16𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂𝑇48𝐿~𝜂superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\leq\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}T}+\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}
≤16​3​L​G2​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)S​T+192​B​L​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)T.absent163𝐿superscript𝐺2𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝑆𝑇192𝐵𝐿𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝑇\displaystyle\leq 16\sqrt{\frac{3LG^{2}(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{ST}}+\frac{192BL(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{T}\,.

The final step used a step-size of η~=min⁡(112​B​L,14​L,S​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)3​L​T​G2)~𝜂112𝐵𝐿14𝐿𝑆𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆3𝐿𝑇superscript𝐺2\tilde{\eta}=\min\left(\frac{1}{12BL},\frac{1}{4L},\sqrt{\frac{S(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{3LTG^{2}}}\right). Here, we used 𝒙out=𝒙τsuperscript𝒙outsuperscript𝒙𝜏\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where τ𝜏\tau is uniformly at random chosen in [T]delimited-[]𝑇[T].

Convergence rate of MimeSGD on PL-inequality.

Multiply Lemma 11 by (1−μ​η~8)T−tsuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t} and sum over t𝑡t

∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−t𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} ≤∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−(t−1)​16​(f​(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)η~absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡1𝑇superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡116𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-(t-1)}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
−(1−μ​η~8)T−t​16​(f​(𝒙t)−f⋆)η~+(1−μ​η~8)T−t​48​L​η~​G2Ssuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡16𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡48𝐿~𝜂superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}+(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}
≤(1−μ​η~8)T​16​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η~+∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−t​48​L​η~​G2S.absentsuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇16𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂superscriptsubscript𝑡1𝑇superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡48𝐿~𝜂superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}+\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Output 𝒙out=𝒙τsuperscript𝒙outsuperscript𝒙𝜏\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where τ𝜏\tau is chosen with probability proportional to (1−μ​η~8)T−tsuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}. Then, this yields

𝔼∥∇f(𝒙out)∥2≤(1−μ​η~8)T16​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η~+48​L​η~​G2S≤𝒪~(σ2μ​T+L(f(𝒙0)−f⋆)exp(−μ​T12​B​L)).\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{\text{out}})\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}+\frac{48L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}\leq\tilde{\mathcal{O}}\left(\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\mu T}+L(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})\exp\left(-\frac{\mu T}{12BL}\right)\right)\,.

Using an appropriate step-size η~~𝜂\tilde{\eta} yields the final rate (see Lemma 1 of [30]).

One round progress for MimeLiteSGD.

Next, we specialize the convergence rate for MimeLite.

Lemma 12.

Suppose f𝑓f is a L𝐿L-smooth function satisfying PL-inequality for μ≥0𝜇0\mu\geq 0 (μ=0𝜇0\mu=0 corresponds to the general case). Running MimeLiteSGD for η~≤112​B​L~𝜂112𝐵𝐿\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12BL} satisfies

η~16𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2≤(1−μ​η~8)(f(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)−(f(𝒙t)−f⋆)+L​η~2​G2S+18L2B2η~3(G2+σ2/K).\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)\,.
Proof.

Recall from Lemma 9 that,

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2≤18L2B2η~2𝔼∥𝒄t∥2≤18L2B2η~2𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+18L2B2η~2G2+9​L2​B2​η~2​σ2K.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq 18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}+\frac{9L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\sigma^{2}}{K}\,.

Combining this with Lemma 10 yields the following progress for Mime

f​(𝒙t)𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t}) ≤f(𝒙t−1)−(η~4−18L2B2η~3)𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+L​η~2​G2S+18L2B2η~3(G2+σ2/K)\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4}-18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\right)\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)
≤f(𝒙t−1)−η~8𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+L​η~2​G2S+18L2B2η~3(G2+σ2/K).\displaystyle\leq f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)\,.

Here, we used the bound on the step size that η~≤112​L​B~𝜂112𝐿𝐵\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{1}{12LB} implies 18​L2​B2​η~2≤1818superscript𝐿2superscript𝐵2superscript~𝜂21818L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\leq\frac{1}{8}. Now using PL-inequality, we can write

f​(𝒙t)−f⋆−𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡limit-fromsuperscript𝑓⋆\displaystyle f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star}- (f​(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)≤𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝑓⋆absent\displaystyle(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})\leq
−μ​η~8(f(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)−η~16𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+L​η~2​G2S+18L2B2η~3(G2+σ2/K).\displaystyle-\frac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8}(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{16}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S}+18L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K\right)\,.

This yields the lemma. ∎

We are now ready to derive the convergence rate.

Convergence rate of MimeLiteSGD on general non-convex functions.

Define G~2=G2+σ2/Ksuperscript~𝐺2superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎2𝐾\tilde{G}^{2}=G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K. Set μ=0𝜇0\mu=0 in Lemma 12 and sum over t𝑡t

1T∑t=1T𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} ≤16​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η~​T+16​L​η~​G2S+288​L2​B2​η~2​G~2absent16𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂𝑇16𝐿~𝜂superscript𝐺2𝑆288superscript𝐿2superscript𝐵2superscript~𝜂2superscript~𝐺2\displaystyle\leq\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}T}+\frac{16L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}+288L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}
≤16​L​G2​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)S​T+84​(L​G~​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)T)2/3+192​B​L​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)T.absent16𝐿superscript𝐺2𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝑆𝑇84superscript𝐿~𝐺𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝑇23192𝐵𝐿𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝑇\displaystyle\leq 16\sqrt{\frac{LG^{2}(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{ST}}+84\left(\frac{L\tilde{G}(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{T}\right)^{2/3}+\frac{192BL(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{T}\,.

The final step used an appropriate step-size of η~~𝜂\tilde{\eta}, see Lemma 2 of [30]. Here, we used 𝒙out=𝒙τsuperscript𝒙outsuperscript𝒙𝜏\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where τ𝜏\tau is uniformly at random chosen in [T]delimited-[]𝑇[T]. Finally note that if K≥σ2G2𝐾superscript𝜎2superscript𝐺2K\geq\frac{\sigma^{2}}{G^{2}}, then G~2≤2​G2superscript~𝐺22superscript𝐺2\tilde{G}^{2}\leq 2G^{2}.

Convergence rate of MimeLiteSGD on PL-inequality.

Multiply Lemma 12 by (1−μ​η~8)T−tsuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t} and sum over t𝑡t

∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−t𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2\displaystyle\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2} ≤∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−(t−1)​16​(f​(𝒙t−1)−f⋆)η~absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑡1𝑇superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡116𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂\displaystyle\leq\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-(t-1)}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
−(1−μ​η~8)T−t​16​(f​(𝒙t)−f⋆)η~superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡16𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt-(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
+∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−t​(16​L​η~​G2S+288​L2​B2​η~2​G~2)superscriptsubscript𝑡1𝑇superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡16𝐿~𝜂superscript𝐺2𝑆288superscript𝐿2superscript𝐵2superscript~𝜂2superscript~𝐺2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\left(\frac{16L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}+288L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}\right)
≤(1−μ​η~8)T​16​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η~absentsuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇16𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆~𝜂\displaystyle\leq(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T}\frac{16(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\tilde{\eta}}
+∑t=1T(1−μ​η~8)T−t​(16​L​η~​G2S+288​L2​B2​η~2​G~2).superscriptsubscript𝑡1𝑇superscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡16𝐿~𝜂superscript𝐺2𝑆288superscript𝐿2superscript𝐵2superscript~𝜂2superscript~𝐺2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\sum_{t=1}^{T}(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}\left(\frac{16L\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{S}+288L^{2}B^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}\right)\,.

Output 𝒙out=𝒙τsuperscript𝒙outsuperscript𝒙𝜏\bm{x}^{\text{out}}=\bm{x}^{\tau} where τ𝜏\tau is chosen with probability proportional to (1−μ​η~8)T−tsuperscript1𝜇~𝜂8𝑇𝑡(1-\tfrac{\mu\tilde{\eta}}{8})^{T-t}. Then, this yields with appropriate step-size η~~𝜂\tilde{\eta} yields the final rate (see Lemma 1 of [30]).

𝔼∥∇f(𝒙out)∥2≤𝒪~(σ2μ​T+L2​G~2μ2​T2+L(f(𝒙0)−f⋆)exp(−μ​T12​B​L)).\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{\text{out}})\rVert^{2}\leq\tilde{\mathcal{O}}\left(\frac{\sigma^{2}}{\mu T}+\frac{L^{2}\tilde{G}^{2}}{\mu^{2}T^{2}}+L(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})\exp\left(-\frac{\mu T}{12BL}\right)\right)\,.

F.3 Convergence of MimeAdam and MimeLiteAdam (Corollary III)

We will largely follow the convergence analysis of [70] for the analysis of Adam. A crucial difference between their setting and ours is that in our algorithm we use the global statistics (second order moment) corresponding to t−1𝑡1t-1 i.e. 𝒗t−1superscript𝒗𝑡1\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}} instead of 𝒗tsuperscript𝒗𝑡\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t}} where the ⋅⋅\sqrt{\cdot} operator is applied element wise. Practically, this does not make a significant difference since the discount (momentum) factor for the second momentum is very large. Theoretically however, this difference simplifies our proof significantly removing otherwise hard to handle stochastic dependencies.

In this section, we will use Adam as our base optimizer with ε0>0subscript𝜀00\varepsilon_{0}>0 parameter for stability and β1=0subscript𝛽10\beta_{1}=0 (i.e. RMSProp). This is identical to the setting in the centralized algorithm analyzed by [70]. The properties of our base optimizer are then:

  • •

    𝒔t=𝒗tsuperscript𝒔𝑡superscript𝒗𝑡\bm{s}^{t}=\bm{v}^{t} which is a running average estimate of the second moment and satisfies 𝒗t>0superscript𝒗𝑡0\bm{v}^{t}>0.

  • •

    𝒰​(𝒈;𝒗t−1)=𝒈𝒗t−1+ε0𝒰𝒈superscript𝒗𝑡1𝒈superscript𝒗𝑡1subscript𝜀0\mathcal{U}(\bm{g};\bm{v}^{t-1})=\frac{\bm{g}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}} for any 𝒈𝒈\bm{g}. This update for any 𝒗t−1superscript𝒗𝑡1\bm{v}^{t-1} is B𝐵B-Lipschitz for B=1ε0𝐵1subscript𝜀0B=\frac{1}{\varepsilon_{0}}.

In this sub-section, all operations on vectors (multiplication, division, addition, comparison) are applied element-wise with appropriate broad-casting.

One round progress of Adam.
Lemma 13 (Effective step-sizes).

Suppose that |∇jfi​(𝐱)|≤Hsubscript∇𝑗subscript𝑓𝑖𝐱𝐻|\nabla_{j}f_{i}(\bm{x})|\leq H. Then Adam has effective step-sizes

1H+ε0​𝒈≤𝒰​(𝒈;𝒗t−1)≤1ε0​𝒈.1𝐻subscript𝜀0𝒈𝒰𝒈superscript𝒗𝑡11subscript𝜀0𝒈\frac{1}{H+\varepsilon_{0}}\bm{g}\leq\mathcal{U}(\bm{g};\bm{v}^{t-1})\leq\frac{1}{\varepsilon_{0}}\bm{g}\,.
Proof.

Recall that 𝒗t=β2​𝒗t−1+(1−β2)​(𝒄t)2superscript𝒗𝑡subscript𝛽2superscript𝒗𝑡11subscript𝛽2superscriptsuperscript𝒄𝑡2\bm{v}^{t}=\beta_{2}\bm{v}^{t-1}+(1-\beta_{2})(\bm{c}^{t})^{2} starting from 𝒗0=0superscript𝒗00\bm{v}^{0}=0. Thus for any t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0, we have 𝒗t≥0superscript𝒗𝑡0\bm{v}^{t}\geq 0 and hence 𝒗t−1+ε0≥ε0superscript𝒗𝑡1subscript𝜀0subscript𝜀0\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}\geq\varepsilon_{0}. For the other side, recall that 𝒗tsuperscript𝒗𝑡\bm{v}^{t} is updated with centralized stochastic gradients 𝒄t=1S​∑i∇fi​(𝒙)superscript𝒄𝑡1𝑆subscript𝑖∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙\bm{c}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}).

[𝒄t]j=1S​∑i[∇fi​(𝒙)]j≤H.subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝒄𝑡𝑗1𝑆subscript𝑖subscriptdelimited-[]∇subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙𝑗𝐻[\bm{c}^{t}]_{j}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i}\left[\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\right]_{j}\leq H\,.

Further,

[𝒗t]j=β2​[𝒗t−1]j+(1−β2)​[𝒄t]j2≤β2​[𝒗t−1]j+(1−β2)​H2≤H2.subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝒗𝑡𝑗subscript𝛽2subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝒗𝑡1𝑗1subscript𝛽2superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝒄𝑡𝑗2subscript𝛽2subscriptdelimited-[]superscript𝒗𝑡1𝑗1subscript𝛽2superscript𝐻2superscript𝐻2[\bm{v}^{t}]_{j}=\beta_{2}[\bm{v}^{t-1}]_{j}+(1-\beta_{2})[\bm{c}^{t}]_{j}^{2}\leq\beta_{2}[\bm{v}^{t-1}]_{j}+(1-\beta_{2})H^{2}\leq H^{2}\,.

Hence 𝒗t−1+ε0≤H+ε0superscript𝒗𝑡1subscript𝜀0𝐻subscript𝜀0\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}+\varepsilon_{0}}\leq H+\varepsilon_{0}. ∎

Lemma 14 (One round progress).

For one round of Adam with error 𝐞tsuperscript𝐞𝑡\bm{e}^{t} in the update 𝒰𝒰\mathcal{U} and using 𝐜tsuperscript𝐜𝑡\bm{c}^{t} for update 𝒱𝒱\mathcal{V}, we have

𝔼f(𝒙t)≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~4​(H+ε0)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​((H+ε0)+ε0/(H+ε0))2​ε02𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+L​η~2​G2S​ε02.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t})\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\,.
Proof.

Starting from Lemma 13 and the smoothness of f𝑓f, we have

𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t)𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) ≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~𝔼⟨∇f(𝒙t−1),𝔼t[𝒰(𝒄t+𝒆t)]⟩+L​η~22𝔼∥𝒰(𝒄t+𝒆t;𝒗t−1)∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{t}[\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\right)]\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{v}^{t-1}\right)\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~𝔼⟨∇f(𝒙t−1),𝔼t[𝒄t+𝒆t𝒗t−1+ε0]⟩+L​η~22𝔼∥𝒰(𝒄t+𝒆t;𝒗t−1)∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{t}\left[\frac{\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\right]\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\mathcal{U}\left(\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t};\bm{v}^{t-1}\right)\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~𝔼⟨∇f(𝒙t−1),[∇f​(𝒙t−1)+𝒆t𝒗t−1+ε0]⟩+L​η~22​ε02𝔼∥𝒄t+𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\left[\frac{\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\right]\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~H+ε0∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2−η~𝔼⟨∇f(𝒙t−1),𝒆t𝒗t−1+ε0⟩+L​η~22​ε02𝔼∥𝒄t+𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{H+\varepsilon_{0}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}-\tilde{\eta}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\langle\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}),\frac{\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\rangle+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~2​(H+ε0)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​(H+ε0)2𝔼∥𝒆t𝒗t−1+ε0∥2+L​η~22​ε02𝔼∥𝒄t+𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\frac{\bm{e}^{t}}{\sqrt{\bm{v}^{t-1}}+\varepsilon_{0}}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}+\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−(η~2​(H+ε0)−L​η~2ε02)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​(H+ε0)+2​L​η~22​ε02𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+L​η~2​G2S​ε02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{2(H+\varepsilon_{0})}-\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\right)\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}(H+\varepsilon_{0})+2L\tilde{\eta}^{2}}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~4​(H+ε0)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​((H+ε0)+ε0/(H+ε0))2​ε02𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+L​η~2​G2S​ε02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}

Here we used our bound on the step-size that η~≤ε04​L​(H+ε0)~𝜂subscript𝜀04𝐿𝐻subscript𝜀0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}}{4L(H+\varepsilon_{0})}. ∎

Convergence of MimeAdam.
Lemma 15.

Suppose that assumptions (A1)–((A3)) hold and further |∇jfi​(𝐱)|≤Hsubscript∇𝑗subscript𝑓𝑖𝐱𝐻|\nabla_{j}f_{i}(\bm{x})|\leq H. Then, running MimeAdam with step-size η~≤ε0212​L​(H+ε0)~𝜂superscriptsubscript𝜀0212𝐿𝐻subscript𝜀0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L(H+\varepsilon_{0})}, we have

1T∑t=1T𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2≤96​L​(H+ε0)2​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)ε02​T+2​G2S.\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{96L(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}(f(\bm{x}_{0})-f^{\star})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}T}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}\,.

Combining Lemma 14 with the bound on 𝒆tsuperscript𝒆𝑡\bm{e}^{t} from Lemma 9 we get,

𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t)𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) ≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~4​(H+ε0)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​((H+ε0)+ε0/(H+ε0))2​ε02𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+L​η~2​G2S​ε02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{2\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~4​(H+ε0)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+9​L2​η~3​((H+ε0)+ε0/(H+ε0))ε04𝔼∥𝒄t∥2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{9L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{c}^{t}\rVert^{2}
+L​η~2​G2S​ε02𝐿superscript~𝜂2superscript𝐺2𝑆superscriptsubscript𝜀02\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t−1)−(η~4​(H+ε0)−9​L2​η~3​((H+ε0)+ε0/(H+ε0))ε04)​∥∇f​(𝒙t−1)∥2absent𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂4𝐻subscript𝜀09superscript𝐿2superscript~𝜂3𝐻subscript𝜀0subscript𝜀0𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptsubscript𝜀04superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡12\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}-\frac{9L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\right)\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
+L​η~2​G2S​ε02+9​L2​η~3​((H+ε0)+ε0/(H+ε0))​G2S​ε04𝐿superscript~𝜂2superscript𝐺2𝑆superscriptsubscript𝜀029superscript𝐿2superscript~𝜂3𝐻subscript𝜀0subscript𝜀0𝐻subscript𝜀0superscript𝐺2𝑆superscriptsubscript𝜀04\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}+\frac{9L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}\left((H+\varepsilon_{0})+\varepsilon_{0}/(H+\varepsilon_{0})\right)G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t−1)−(η~4​(H+ε0)−18​L2​η~3​(H+ε0)ε04)​∥∇f​(𝒙t−1)∥2absent𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂4𝐻subscript𝜀018superscript𝐿2superscript~𝜂3𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptsubscript𝜀04superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡12\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\left(\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}-\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\right)\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
+L​η~2​G2S​ε02+18​L2​η~3​(H+ε0)​G2S​ε04𝐿superscript~𝜂2superscript𝐺2𝑆superscriptsubscript𝜀0218superscript𝐿2superscript~𝜂3𝐻subscript𝜀0superscript𝐺2𝑆superscriptsubscript𝜀04\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}+\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t−1)−η~8​(H+ε0)​∥∇f​(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​G24​S​(H+ε0).absent𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂8𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡12~𝜂superscript𝐺24𝑆𝐻subscript𝜀0\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}G^{2}}{4S(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\,.

To simplify computations, here we assumed we assumed (H+ε0)2≥ε0superscript𝐻subscript𝜀02subscript𝜀0(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}\geq\varepsilon_{0} without loss of generality. If this is not true, we can replace H𝐻H by max⁡(H,ε0−ε0)𝐻subscript𝜀0subscript𝜀0\max(H,\sqrt{\varepsilon_{0}}-\varepsilon_{0}). Assuming η~≤ε0212​L​(H+ε0)~𝜂superscriptsubscript𝜀0212𝐿𝐻subscript𝜀0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L(H+\varepsilon_{0})}, we have 18​L2​η~2​(H+ε0)ε04≤18​(H+ε0)18superscript𝐿2superscript~𝜂2𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptsubscript𝜀0418𝐻subscript𝜀0\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\leq\frac{1}{8(H+\varepsilon_{0})}. Rearranging the terms and substituting the bounds on the step-size yields the lemma.

Convergence of MimeLiteAdam.
Lemma 16.

Suppose that assumptions (A1)–((A3)) hold and further |∇jfi​(𝐱)|≤Hsubscript∇𝑗subscript𝑓𝑖𝐱𝐻|\nabla_{j}f_{i}(\bm{x})|\leq H. Then, running MimeLiteAdam with step-size η~≤ε0212​L​S​(H+ε0)~𝜂superscriptsubscript𝜀0212𝐿𝑆𝐻subscript𝜀0\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L\sqrt{S}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}, we have for G~2:=G2+σ2/Kassignsuperscript~𝐺2superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎2𝐾\tilde{G}^{2}:=G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K,

1T∑t=1T𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2≤96​L​S​(H+ε0)2​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)ε02​T+2​G~2S.\frac{1}{T}\sum_{t=1}^{T}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{96L\sqrt{S}(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}(f(\bm{x}_{0})-f^{\star})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}T}+\frac{2\tilde{G}^{2}}{S}\,.

Combining Lemma 14 with the bound on 𝒆tsuperscript𝒆𝑡\bm{e}^{t} from Lemma 9 we get for G~2:=G2+σ2/Kassignsuperscript~𝐺2superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎2𝐾\tilde{G}^{2}:=G^{2}+\sigma^{2}/K,

𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t)𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t}) ≤𝔼f(𝒙t−1)−η~4​(H+ε0)∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​(H+ε0)ε02𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+L​η~2​G2S​ε02\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t−1)−η~4​(H+ε0)​∥∇f​(𝒙t−1)∥2absent𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂4𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡12\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{4(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}
+18​L2​η~3​(H+ε0)ε04𝔼∥∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2+18​L2​η~3​(H+ε0)​(G~2)ε04+L​η~2​G2S​ε02\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{3}(H+\varepsilon_{0})(\tilde{G}^{2})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}+\frac{L\tilde{\eta}^{2}G^{2}}{S\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t−1)−η~8​(H+ε0)​∥∇f​(𝒙t−1)∥2+η~​G~24​S​(H+ε0)absent𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1~𝜂8𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡12~𝜂superscript~𝐺24𝑆𝐻subscript𝜀0\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\frac{\tilde{\eta}}{8(H+\varepsilon_{0})}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\rVert^{2}+\frac{\tilde{\eta}\tilde{G}^{2}}{4S(H+\varepsilon_{0})}

Again as before to simplify computations, here we assumed (H+ε0)2≥ε0superscript𝐻subscript𝜀02subscript𝜀0(H+\varepsilon_{0})^{2}\geq\varepsilon_{0} without loss of generality. If this is not true, we can replace H𝐻H by max⁡(H,ε0−ε0)𝐻subscript𝜀0subscript𝜀0\max(H,\sqrt{\varepsilon_{0}}-\varepsilon_{0}). Assuming η~≤ε0212​L​(H+ε0)​S~𝜂superscriptsubscript𝜀0212𝐿𝐻subscript𝜀0𝑆\tilde{\eta}\leq\frac{\varepsilon_{0}^{2}}{12L(H+\varepsilon_{0})\sqrt{S}}, we have 18​L2​η~2​(H+ε0)ε04≤18​S​(H+ε0)18superscript𝐿2superscript~𝜂2𝐻subscript𝜀0superscriptsubscript𝜀0418𝑆𝐻subscript𝜀0\frac{18L^{2}\tilde{\eta}^{2}(H+\varepsilon_{0})}{\varepsilon_{0}^{4}}\leq\frac{1}{8S(H+\varepsilon_{0})}. Rearranging the terms and substituting the bounds on the step-size yields the lemma.

Appendix G Circumventing server-only lower bounds

In this section we see how to use momentum based variance reduction [14, 57] to reduce the variance of the updates and improve convergence. It should be noted that MVR does not exactly fit the Mime framework (BaseAlg) since it requires computing gradients at two points on the same batch. However, it is straightforward to extend the idea of Mime to MVR as we will now do. We use MVR as a theoretical justification for why the usual momentum works well in practice. An interesting future direction would be to adapt the algorithm and analysis of [13], which does fit the framework of Mime.

For the sake of convenience, we summarize the notation used in the proof in a table.

G.1 Algorithm descriptions

Now, we formally describe the Mime MVR and MimeLite MVR algorithms. In each round t𝑡t, we sample clients 𝒮tsuperscript𝒮𝑡\mathcal{S}^{t} such that |𝒮t|=Ssuperscript𝒮𝑡𝑆\lvert\mathcal{S}^{t}\rvert=S. The server communicates the server parameters 𝒙t−1superscript𝒙𝑡1\bm{x}^{t-1}, the past parameters 𝒙t−2superscript𝒙𝑡2\bm{x}^{t-2}, and the momentum 𝒎t−1superscript𝒎𝑡1\bm{m}^{t-1} term. Mime additionally uses a control variate 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1} as we describe next.

Control variate in Mime.

Mime uses an additional control variate 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1} to reduce the variance.

𝒄t−1=1S​∑i∈𝒮t∇fi​(𝒙t−2).superscript𝒄𝑡11𝑆subscript𝑖superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙𝑡2\bm{c}^{t-1}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-2})\,. (12)

Note that both 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1} and 𝒎t−1superscript𝒎𝑡1\bm{m}^{t-1} use gradients and parameters from previous rounds (different from the previous section). A naive implementation of this method requires two steps of communication per round to implement this algorithm. Alternatively, we can reserve some clients in the previous round for computing 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1} which can then be used in the current round, removing the need for two steps of communication. In particular, it can be computed on a different set of an independent sampled clients 𝒮~t−1superscript~𝒮𝑡1\tilde{\mathcal{S}}^{t-1}. In fact, all our theoretical results hold even if we use a single client to perform the local updates and the rest of clients are used only to compute 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1} each round.

Local client updates.

Then each client i∈𝒮t𝑖superscript𝒮𝑡i\in\mathcal{S}^{t} makes a copy 𝒚i,0t=𝒙t−1superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖0𝑡superscript𝒙𝑡1\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t}=\bm{x}^{t-1} and perform K𝐾K local client updates. In each local client update k∈[K]𝑘delimited-[]𝐾k\in[K], the client samples a dataset ζi,ktsuperscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡\zeta_{i,k}^{t}. Mime performs the following update:

𝒚i,kt=𝒚i,k−1t−η​𝒅i,kt, where 𝒅i,kt=a​(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt)−∇fi​(𝒙t−1;ζi,kt)+𝒄t−1)+(1−a)​𝒎t−1+(1−a)​(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt)−∇fi​(𝒙t−1;ζi,kt)).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡𝜂superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡 where superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡𝑎∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙𝑡1superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡superscript𝒄𝑡11𝑎superscript𝒎𝑡11𝑎∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙𝑡1superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡\begin{split}\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}&=\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\,,\text{ where }\\ \bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}&=a(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+\bm{c}^{t-1})+(1-a)\bm{m}^{t-1}\\ &\hskip 56.9055pt+(1-a)(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))\,.\end{split} (13)

MimeLite on the other hand uses a very similar but simpler update scheme which does not rely on 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1}:

𝒚i,kt=𝒚i,k−1t−η​𝒅i,kt, where 𝒅i,kt=a​∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt)+(1−a)​𝒎t−1+(1−a)​(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt)−∇fi​(𝒙t−1;ζi,kt)).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡𝜂superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡 where superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡𝑎∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡1𝑎superscript𝒎𝑡11𝑎∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙𝑡1superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡\begin{split}\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}&=\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\,,\text{ where }\\ \bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}&=a\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})+(1-a)\bm{m}^{t-1}\\ &\hskip 56.9055pt+(1-a)(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-1};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))\,.\end{split} (14)
Server updates.

After K𝐾K such local updates, the server then aggregates the new client parameters as

𝒙t=1S​∑j∈𝒮t𝒚j,Kt.superscript𝒙𝑡1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑗𝐾𝑡\bm{x}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t}\,. (15)

The momentum term is updated at the end of the round for a≥0𝑎0a\geq 0 as

𝒎t=a​(1S​∑j∈𝒮t∇fj​(𝒙t−1))+(1−a)​𝒎t−1⏟SGDm+(1−a)​(1S​∑j∈𝒮t∇fj​(𝒙t−1)−∇fj​(𝒙t−2))⏟correction.superscript𝒎𝑡subscript⏟𝑎1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡11𝑎superscript𝒎𝑡1SGDmsubscript⏟1𝑎1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡1∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡2correction\bm{m}^{t}=\underbrace{a(\tfrac{1}{S}\textstyle\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1}))+(1-a)\bm{m}^{t-1}}_{\text{SGDm}}+\underbrace{(1-a)(\tfrac{1}{S}\textstyle\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2}))}_{\text{correction}}\,. (16)

As we can see, the momentum update of MVR can be broken down into the usual SGDm update, and a correction. Intuitively, this correction term is very small since fisubscript𝑓𝑖f_{i} is smooth and 𝒙t−1≈𝒙t−2superscript𝒙𝑡1superscript𝒙𝑡2\bm{x}^{t-1}\approx\bm{x}^{t-2}. Another way of looking at the update (16) is to note that if all functions are identical i.e. fj=fksubscript𝑓𝑗subscript𝑓𝑘f_{j}=f_{k} for any j,k𝑗𝑘j,k, then (16) just becomes the usual gradient descent. Thus MimeMVR tries to maintain an exponential moving average of only the variance terms, reducing its bias. We refer to [14] for more detailed explanation of MVR.

G.2 Bias in updates

The main difference in MimeMVR from the centralized versions of [57, 14] is the additional local steps which are biased. In particular, for k≥1𝑘1k\geq 1 the expected gradient 𝔼⁡[∇fi​(𝒚i,kt)]≠∇f​(𝒚i,kt)𝔼∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡∇𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}[\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})]\neq\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}) because 𝒚i,ktsuperscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t} also depends on the sample i𝑖i. This bias is in fact the underlying cause of client drift and controlling it is a crucial step for our analysis.

Lemma 17 (Mime bias).

For any values of 𝐱𝐱\bm{x} and 𝐲isubscript𝐲𝑖\bm{y}_{i} where 𝐲isubscript𝐲𝑖\bm{y}_{i} may depend on i𝑖i, the following holds for any client i𝑖i almost surely given that ((A1)) and ((A2)) hold:

𝔼𝒮,ζ∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)+1|𝒮|∑j∈𝒮∇fj(𝒙)−∇fi(𝒙;ζ)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2≤2δ2𝔼𝒮∥𝒚i−𝒙∥2+2​G2S.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S},\zeta}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)\quad-\quad\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}\leq 2\delta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

We can separate the noise from the rest of the terms and expand as

𝔼ζ,𝒮∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)+1|𝒮|∑j∈𝒮∇fj(𝒙)−∇fi(𝒙;ζ)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\zeta,\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}
≤2𝔼𝒮∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)+∇f(𝒙)−∇fi(𝒙;ζ)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2+2𝔼𝒮∥1|𝒮|∑j∈𝒮∇fj(𝒙)−∇f(𝒙)∥2\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\frac{1}{\lvert\mathcal{S}\rvert}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\rVert^{2}
≤2𝔼𝒮∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)+∇f(𝒙)−∇fi(𝒙;ζ)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2+2​G2S\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}
≤2​𝔼𝒮⁡δ2​∥𝒚i−𝒙∥2+2​G2S.absent2subscript𝔼𝒮superscript𝛿2superscriptdelimited-∥∥subscript𝒚𝑖𝒙22superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\mathcal{S}}\delta^{2}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2G^{2}}{S}\,.

The first inequality used Young’s inequality, the second used ((A1)), and the last used ((A2)) in the form of Lemma 3. ∎

We can perform a similar analysis of the bias of local updates encountered by MimeLite.

Lemma 18 (MimeLite bias).

For any values of 𝐱𝐱\bm{x} and 𝐲isubscript𝐲𝑖\bm{y}_{i} where 𝐲isubscript𝐲𝑖\bm{y}_{i} may depend on i𝑖i, the following holds for any client i𝑖i randomly chosen from 𝒟𝒟\mathcal{D} given that ((A1)), ((A2)) and ((A3)) hold:

𝔼i,ζ∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2≤2δ2𝔼i∥𝒚i−𝒙∥2+2G2+σ2.\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i,\zeta}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)\quad-\quad\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}\leq 2\delta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}\,.
Proof.

We can separate the noise from the rest of the terms and expand as

𝔼ζ,i∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\zeta,i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2} =𝔼ζ,i∥∇fi(𝒚i;ζ)±∇fi(𝒙)±∇f(𝒙)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{\zeta,i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i};\zeta)\pm\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\pm\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}
≤𝔼i∥∇fi(𝒚i)±∇fi(𝒙)±∇f(𝒙)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2+σ2\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i})\pm\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})\pm\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+\sigma^{2}
≤2𝔼i∥∇fi(𝒚i)+∇f(𝒙)−∇fi(𝒙)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i})+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}
+2𝔼i∥∇fi(𝒙)−∇f(𝒙)∥2+σ2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{x})\right\rVert^{2}+\sigma^{2}
≤2𝔼i∥∇fi(𝒚i)+∇f(𝒙)−∇fi(𝒙)−∇f(𝒚i)∥2+2G2+σ2\displaystyle\leq 2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\left\lVert\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i})+\nabla f(\bm{x})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i})\right\rVert^{2}+2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}
≤2δ2𝔼i∥𝒚i−𝒙∥2+2G2+σ2.\displaystyle\leq 2\delta^{2}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}_{i}\lVert\bm{y}_{i}-\bm{x}\rVert^{2}+2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}\,.

The first inequality used ((A3)), the second used Young’s inequality, the third used ((A1)), and the last used ((A2)) in the form of Lemma 3. ∎

Note that the bias for MimeLite is very similar to that of Mime, except that Mime has dependence of G2Ssuperscript𝐺2𝑆\frac{G^{2}}{S}, whereas MimeLite has G2+σ2superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎2G^{2}+\sigma^{2}. Hence, the rate of convergence of MimeLite will depend on G2superscript𝐺2G^{2} wheras Mime will have the optimal dependency of G2/Ssuperscript𝐺2𝑆G^{2}/S. Hence, in the rest of the proof, we will consider only Mime and simply replace G2/Ssuperscript𝐺2𝑆G^{2}/S with (G2+σ2)superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎2(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}) to obtain the corresponding results for MimeLite.

G.3 Change in each client update

Client update variance.

Now we examine the variance of our update in each local step 𝒅i,ktsuperscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}.

Lemma 19.

For the client update (13), given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds for any a∈[0,1]𝑎01a\in[0,1] where 𝐞t:=𝐦t−∇f​(𝐱t−1)assignsuperscript𝐞𝑡superscript𝐦𝑡∇𝑓superscript𝐱𝑡1\bm{e}^{t}:=\bm{m}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}) and Δi,kt:=𝔼∥𝐲i,kt−𝐱t−2∥2\Delta_{i,k}^{t}:=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}:

𝔼∥𝒅i,kt−∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2≤3𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3δ2Δi,k−1t+3​a2​G2S.\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq 3\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+3\delta^{2}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

Starting from the client update (13), we can rewrite it as

𝒅i,kt−∇f​(𝒚i,k−1t)superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡∇𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡\displaystyle\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}) =(1−a)​𝒆t−1absent1𝑎superscript𝒆𝑡1\displaystyle=(1-a)\bm{e}^{t-1}
+(∇fi(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt)−∇fi(𝒙t−2;ζi,kt))−∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)+∇f(𝒙t−2))\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+\left(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-2};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})+\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right)
+a​(1S​∑j∈𝒮t∇fj​(𝒙t−2)−∇f​(𝒙t−2)).𝑎1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡2∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+a\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right)\,.

We can use the relaxed triangle inequality Lemma 1 to claim

𝔼∥𝒅i,kt−∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
=3(1−a)2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2\displaystyle=3(1-a)^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+3​(1−a)2​∥(∇fi​(𝒚i,k−1t;ζi,kt)−∇fi​(𝒙t−2;ζi,kt))−(∇f​(𝒚i,k−1t)−∇f​(𝒙t−2))∥23superscript1𝑎2superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑖superscript𝒙𝑡2superscriptsubscript𝜁𝑖𝑘𝑡∇𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡22\displaystyle+3(1-a)^{2}\left\lVert(\nabla f_{i}(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t};\zeta_{i,k}^{t})-\nabla f_{i}(\bm{x}^{t-2};\zeta_{i,k}^{t}))-(\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2}))\right\rVert^{2}
+3​a2​∥1S​∑j∈𝒮t∇fj​(𝒙t−2)−∇f​(𝒙t−2)∥23superscript𝑎2superscriptdelimited-∥∥1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡2∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡22\displaystyle+3a^{2}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right\rVert^{2}
≤3𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3δ2∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−2∥2+3​a2​G2S.\displaystyle\leq 3\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+3\delta^{2}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

The last inequality used the Hessian similarity Lemma 3 to bound the second term and the heterogeneity bound ((A1)) to bound the last term. Also, (1−a)2≤1superscript1𝑎21(1-a)^{2}\leq 1 since a∈[0,1]𝑎01a\in[0,1]. ∎

Distance moved in each step.

We show that the distance moved by a client in each step during the client update can be controlled.

Lemma 20.

For MimeMVR updates (13) with η≤16​K​δ𝜂16𝐾𝛿\eta\leq\frac{1}{6K\delta} and given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds

Δi,kt≤(1+1K)Δi,k−1t+18η2Ka2G2S+18η2K𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+6η2K∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2,\Delta_{i,k}^{t}\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+18\eta^{2}Ka^{2}\frac{G^{2}}{S}+18\eta^{2}K\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+6\eta^{2}K\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,,

where we define Δi,kt:=𝔼∥𝐲i,kt−𝐱t−2∥2\Delta_{i,k}^{t}:=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}.

Proof.

Starting from the MimeMVR update (13) and the relaxed triangle inequality with c=2​K𝑐2𝐾c=2K,

𝔼∥𝒚i,kt−𝒙t−2∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2} =𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−η𝒅i,kt−𝒙t−2∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+12​K)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−2∥2+(2K+1)η2𝔼∥𝒅i,kt∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+(2K+1)\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+12​K)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−2∥2+6Kη2𝔼∥𝒅i,kt−∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+6Kη2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
≤(1+12​K+18Kη2δ2)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−2∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}+18K\eta^{2}\delta^{2}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}
+18Kη2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+18​K​η2​a2​G2S+6Kη2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+18K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{18K\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

The last inequality used the update variance bound Lemma 19. We can simplify the expression further since η≤16​K​δ𝜂16𝐾𝛿\eta\leq\frac{1}{6K\delta} implies 18​K​η2​δ2≤12​K18𝐾superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿212𝐾18K\eta^{2}\delta^{2}\leq\frac{1}{2K}. ∎

Progress in one step.

Now we can compute the progress made in each step.

Lemma 21.

For any client update step with step size η≤min⁡(1L,1192​δ​K)𝜂1𝐿1192𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{192\delta K}\right) and given that ((A1)), ((A2)) hold, we have

𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,kt)+δ​(1+2K)K−k​Δi,kt𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k}^{t} ≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,k−1t)+δ​(1+2K)K−(k−1)​Δi,k−1tabsent𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘1superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘1𝑡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}
−η4𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2+3η𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​a2​G2S.\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt-\frac{\eta}{4}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+3\eta\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.
Proof.

The assumption that f𝑓f is L𝐿L-smooth implies a quadratic upper bound (10).

f​(𝒚i,kt)−f​(𝒚i,k−1t)𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡\displaystyle f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})-f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}) ≤−η​⟨∇f​(𝒚i,k−1t),𝒅i,kt⟩+L​η22​∥𝒅i,kt∥2absent𝜂∇𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡𝐿superscript𝜂22superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡2\displaystyle\leq-\eta\langle\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}),\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rangle+\frac{L\eta^{2}}{2}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}
=−η2​∥∇f​(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2+L​η2−η2​∥𝒅i,kt∥2+η2​∥𝒅i,kt−∇f​(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.absent𝜂2superscriptdelimited-∥∥∇𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡2𝐿superscript𝜂2𝜂2superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡2𝜂2superscriptdelimited-∥∥superscriptsubscript𝒅𝑖𝑘𝑡∇𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡2\displaystyle=-\frac{\eta}{2}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{L\eta^{2}-\eta}{2}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{\eta}{2}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

The second equality used the fact that for any a,b𝑎𝑏a,b, −2​a​b=(a−b)2−a2−b22𝑎𝑏superscript𝑎𝑏2superscript𝑎2superscript𝑏2-2ab=(a-b)^{2}-a^{2}-b^{2}. The second term can be removed since η≤1L𝜂1𝐿\eta\leq\frac{1}{L}. Taking expectation on both sides and using the update variance bound Lemma 19,

𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,kt)−𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,k−1t)𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})-\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}) ≤−η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2+3​η​a2​G22​S\displaystyle\leq-\frac{\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{2S}
+3​η2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​δ22Δi,k−1t\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{3\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta\delta^{2}}{2}\Delta^{t}_{i,k-1}
≤−η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2+3​η​a2​G22​S\displaystyle\leq-\frac{\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{2S}
+3​η2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​δ22Δi,k−1t\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+\frac{3\eta}{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta\delta^{2}}{2}\Delta^{t}_{i,k-1}

Multiplying the distance bound Lemma 20 by δ​(1+2K)K−k𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}. Note that for any K≥1𝐾1K\geq 1 and k∈[K]𝑘delimited-[]𝐾k\in[K], we have 1≤(1+2K)K−k≤81superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘81\leq\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\leq 8. Then we get

δ​(1+2K)K−k​Δi,kt𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘𝑡\displaystyle\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k}^{t} ≤δ(1+2K)K−k((1+1K)Δi,k−1t+18η2Ka2G2S\displaystyle\leq\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Bigg{(}\Big{(}1+\frac{1}{K}\Big{)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+18\eta^{2}Ka^{2}\frac{G^{2}}{S}
+18η2K𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+6η2K∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2)\displaystyle\hskip 85.35826pt+18\eta^{2}K\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+6\eta^{2}K\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\Bigg{)}
≤δ​(1+2K)K−(k−1)​Δi,k−1t−δK​(1+2K)K−k​Δi,k−1tabsent𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘1superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘1𝑡𝛿𝐾superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘1𝑡\displaystyle\leq\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}-\frac{\delta}{K}\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}
+48η2δK𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2+144​η2​δ​K​a2​G2S+144η2δK𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+48\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}+\frac{144\eta^{2}\delta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}+144\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
≤δ(1+2K)K−(k−1)Δi,k−1t−δKΔi,k−1t+48η2δK𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\leq\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}-\frac{\delta}{K}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}+48\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+144​η2​δ​K​a2​G2S+144η2δK𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2.\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\frac{144\eta^{2}\delta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}+144\eta^{2}\delta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}\,.

Adding these two inequalities together yields

𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,kt)+δ​(1+2K)K−k​Δi,kt𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘𝑡𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘𝑡\displaystyle\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-k}\Delta_{i,k}^{t} ≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,k−1t)+δ​(1+2K)K−(k−1)​Δi,k−1tabsent𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝑘1𝑡𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾𝑘1superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝑘1𝑡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K-(k-1)}\Delta_{i,k-1}^{t}
−(η2−48η2δK)𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-\left(\frac{\eta}{2}-48\eta^{2}\delta K\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+(3​η2+144η2δK)𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\left(\frac{3\eta}{2}+144\eta^{2}\delta K\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+(3​η2++144η2δK)a2​G2S.\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\left(\frac{3\eta}{2}++144\eta^{2}\delta K\right)\frac{a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Using our bound on the step-size that η≤1192​δ​K𝜂1192𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\frac{1}{192\delta K} implies that η​δ​K≤148∗4𝜂𝛿𝐾1484\eta\delta K\leq\frac{1}{48*4}. ∎

G.4 Change in each round

We now see how the quantities we defined change across rounds.

Distance moved in a round.
Lemma 22.

For MimeMVR updates (13) with η≤16​K​δ𝜂16𝐾𝛿\eta\leq\frac{1}{6K\delta} and given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds

Δt≤54K2η2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+54​K2​η2​a2​G2S+1K​S∑i,k18K2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2,\Delta^{t}\leq 54K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{54K^{2}\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}18K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,,

where we define Δt:=𝔼∥𝐱t−𝐱t−1∥2\Delta^{t}:=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}.

Proof.

Starting from the MimeMVR update (13) and following the proof of Lemma 20,

𝔼∥𝒚i,kt−𝒙t−1∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2} =𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−η𝒅i,kt−𝒙t−1∥2\displaystyle=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\eta\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+12​K)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−1∥2+(2K+1)η2𝔼∥𝒅i,kt∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+(2K+1)\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≤(1+12​K)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−1∥2+6Kη2𝔼∥𝒅i,kt−∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{2K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{d}_{i,k}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+6Kη2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
≤(1+1K)𝔼∥𝒚i,k−1t−𝒙t−1∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+18Kη2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+18​K​η2​a2​G2S+6Kη2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.\displaystyle\hskip 56.9055pt+18K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{18K\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

Note that 𝒙t=1S​∑i∈𝒮𝒚i,Ktsuperscript𝒙𝑡1𝑆subscript𝑖𝒮superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝐾𝑡\bm{x}^{t}=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t} and so,

𝔼∥𝒙t−𝒙t−1∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
≤1S∑i∈𝒮𝔼∥𝒚i,Kt−𝒙t−1∥2\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
≤1S∑i∈𝒮∑k(18Kη2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+18​K​η2​a2​G2S+6Kη2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2)(1+1K)K−k\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{S}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}}\sum_{k}\left(18K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{18K\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+6K\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\right)\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)^{K-k}
≤54K2η2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+54​K2​η2​a2​G2S+1K​S∑i,k18K2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.\displaystyle\leq 54K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{54K^{2}\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}18K^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

Here we used the inequality that for all k𝑘k, (1+1K)K−k≤3superscript11𝐾𝐾𝑘3\left(1+\frac{1}{K}\right)^{K-k}\leq 3. ∎

Server momentum variance.

We compute the error of the server momentum 𝒎t−1superscript𝒎𝑡1\bm{m}^{t-1} defined as 𝒆t=𝒎t−∇f​(𝒙t−1)superscript𝒆𝑡superscript𝒎𝑡∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1\bm{e}^{t}=\bm{m}^{t}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1}). Its expected norm can be bounded as follows.

Lemma 23.

For the momentum update (16), given ((A1)) and ((A2)), the following holds for any η≤151​δ​K𝜂151𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\frac{1}{51\delta K} and 1≥a≥2592​K2​δ2​η21𝑎2592superscript𝐾2superscript𝛿2superscript𝜂21\geq a\geq 2592K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2},

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2≤(1−23​a24)𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​a2​G2S+1K​S∑i,k36K2δ2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq(1-\tfrac{23a}{24})\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}36K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.
Proof.

Starting from the momentum update (16),

𝒆tsuperscript𝒆𝑡\displaystyle\bm{e}^{t} =(1−a)​𝒆t−1absent1𝑎superscript𝒆𝑡1\displaystyle=(1-a)\bm{e}^{t-1}
+(1−a)​(1S​∑j∈𝒮t(∇fj​(𝒙t−1)−∇fj​(𝒙t−2))−∇f​(𝒙t−1)+∇f​(𝒙t−2))1𝑎1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡1∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡2∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+(1-a)\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2}))-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right)
+a(1S∑j∈𝒮t(∇fj(𝒙t−1)−∇f(𝒙t−1)).\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+a\left(\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\right)\,.

Now, the term 𝒆t−1superscript𝒆𝑡1\bm{e}^{t-1} does not have any information from round t𝑡t and hence is statistically independent of the rest of the terms. Further, the rest of the terms have mean 0. Hence, we can separate out the zero mean noise terms from the 𝒆t−1superscript𝒆𝑡1\bm{e}^{t-1} following Lemma 2 and then the relaxed triangle inequality Lemma 1 to claim

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2} ≤(1−a)2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2\displaystyle\leq(1-a)^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}
+2​(1−a)2​∥1S​∑j∈𝒮t(∇fj​(𝒙t−1)−∇fj​(𝒙t−2))−∇f​(𝒙t−1)+∇f​(𝒙t−2)∥22superscript1𝑎2superscriptdelimited-∥∥1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡1∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙𝑡2∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡1∇𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡22\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+2(1-a)^{2}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-2}))-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-2})\right\rVert^{2}
+2a2∥1S∑j∈𝒮t(∇fj(𝒙t−1)−∇f(𝒙t−1)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+2a^{2}\left\lVert\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}(\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{t-1})-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{t-1})\right\rVert^{2}
≤(1−a)2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+2(1−a)2δ2∥𝒙t−1−𝒙t−2∥2+2​a2​G2S.\displaystyle\leq(1-a)^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+2(1-a)^{2}\delta^{2}\lVert\bm{x}^{t-1}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

The inequality used the Hessian similarity Lemma 3 to bound the second term and the heterogeneity bound ((A1)) to bound the last term. Finally, note that (1−a)2≤(1−a)≤1superscript1𝑎21𝑎1(1-a)^{2}\leq(1-a)\leq 1 for a∈[0,1]𝑎01a\in[0,1]. We can continue by bounding Δt−1superscriptΔ𝑡1\Delta^{t-1} using Lemma 22.

𝔼∥𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2} ≤(1−a)𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+2δ2Δt−1+2​a2​G2S\displaystyle\leq(1-a)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+2\delta^{2}\Delta^{t-1}+\frac{2a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
≤(1−a)𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+2​a2​G2S\displaystyle\leq(1-a)\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{2a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
+108K2δ2η2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+108​K2​δ2​η2​a2​G2S+1K​S∑i,k36K2δ2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+108K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{108K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}36K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
≤(1−23​a24)𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​a2​G2S+1K​S∑i,k36K2δ2η2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.\displaystyle\leq(1-\tfrac{23a}{24})\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}36K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

The last step used our bound on the momentum parameter that 1≥a≥2592​η2​δ2​K21𝑎2592superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾21\geq a\geq 2592\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}. Note that η≤151​δ​K𝜂151𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\frac{1}{51\delta K} ensures that this set is non-empty. ∎

Progress in one round.

Finally, we can compute the progress made in a round. Note that we need a technical condition that f𝑓f is δ𝛿\delta-weakly convex. However, this is only needed because we insist on running the algorithm on S𝑆S clients in parallel and then averaging their weights—the averaging requires weak convexity to ensure that the loss doesn’t blow up. It has been experimentally observed in [41] that with the right initialization, averaging of the parameters does not increase the loss value and so weak convexity within this region might be vaalid. Finally note that if we instead simply run the local updates on a single chosen client with all the rest only being used to compute 𝒄t−1superscript𝒄𝑡1\bm{c}^{t-1}, we will retain all convergence rates without needing weak-convexity.

Lemma 24.

For any round of MimeMVR with step size η≤min⁡(1L,1864​δ​K)𝜂1𝐿1864𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K}\right) and momentum parameter a≥912​η2​δ2​K2𝑎912superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾2a\geq 912\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}. Then, given that ((A1))–((A2)) hold and f𝑓f is δ𝛿\delta-weakly convex, we have

η24​K​S∑k∈[K],j∈𝒮t𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2≤Φt−1−Φt+17​η​a​δ2​K2​G2S,\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{24KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq\Phi^{t-1}-\Phi^{t}+\frac{17\eta a\delta^{2}K^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,,

where we define the sequence

Φt:=1K𝔼[f(𝒙t)−f⋆]+96​η23​a𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+8​δKΔt.\Phi^{t}:=\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}\,.
Proof.

We start by summing over the progress in single client updates as in Lemma 21

∑k∈[K]η4𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,0t)∥2\displaystyle\sum_{k\in[K]}\frac{\eta}{4}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t})\rVert^{2} ≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,0t)+δ​(1+2K)K​Δi,0tabsent𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖0𝑡𝛿superscript12𝐾𝐾superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖0𝑡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t})+\delta\left(1+\frac{2}{K}\right)^{K}\Delta_{i,0}^{t}
−𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,Kt)−δ​Δi,Kt𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝐾𝑡𝛿superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝐾𝑡\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t})-\delta\Delta_{i,K}^{t}
+3ηK𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​K​a2​G2S\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+3\eta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,0t)+8​δ​Δi,0t−𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,Kt)−δ​Δi,Ktabsent𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖0𝑡8𝛿superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖0𝑡𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝐾𝑡𝛿superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝐾𝑡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,0}^{t})+8\delta\Delta_{i,0}^{t}-\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t})-\delta\Delta_{i,K}^{t}
+3ηK𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​K​a2​G2S\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+3\eta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}
≤𝔼⁡f​(𝒙t−1)+8​δ​Δt−1−𝔼⁡f​(𝒚i,Kt)−δ​Δi,Ktabsent𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡18𝛿superscriptΔ𝑡1𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑖𝐾𝑡𝛿superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖𝐾𝑡\displaystyle\leq\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{x}^{t-1})+8\delta\Delta^{t-1}-\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}f(\bm{y}_{i,K}^{t})-\delta\Delta_{i,K}^{t}
