+3ηK𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​K​a2​G2S.\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+3\eta K\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta Ka^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

Recall that Δi,kt=𝔼∥𝒚i,kt−𝒙t−2∥2\Delta_{i,k}^{t}=\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{y}_{i,k}^{t}-\bm{x}^{t-2}\rVert^{2} and 𝒚i,0t=𝒙t−1subscriptsuperscript𝒚𝑡𝑖0superscript𝒙𝑡1\bm{y}^{t}_{i,0}=\bm{x}^{t-1}. This gives the last step above, making Δi,0t=Δt−1superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑖0𝑡superscriptΔ𝑡1\Delta_{i,0}^{t}=\Delta^{t-1}. Then by the averaging Lemma 4, we have

1S​∑j∈𝒮t𝔼⁡[f​(𝒚j,Kt)]+δ​Δj,Kt1𝑆subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡𝔼𝑓superscriptsubscript𝒚𝑗𝐾𝑡𝛿superscriptsubscriptΔ𝑗𝐾𝑡\displaystyle\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t})]+\delta\Delta_{j,K}^{t} =1S∑j∈𝒮𝔼[f(𝒚j,Kt)]+δ𝔼∥𝒙t−2−𝒚j,Kt∥2\displaystyle=\frac{1}{S}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t})]+\delta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t-2}-\bm{y}_{j,K}^{t}\rVert^{2}
≥𝔼[f(𝒙t)]+δ𝔼∥𝒙t−2−𝒙t∥2.\displaystyle\geq\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+\delta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{x}^{t-2}-\bm{x}^{t}\rVert^{2}\,.

So by averaging our inequality over the sampled clients, and diving our summation over the updates by K𝐾K, we get

η4​K​S∑k∈[K],j∈𝒮t𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
≤1K𝔼[f(𝒙t−1)]+3η𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+8​δKΔt−1−1K𝔼[f(𝒙t)]+3​η​a2​G2S.\displaystyle\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]+3\eta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}\,.

We can use the bound on ΔtsubscriptΔ𝑡\Delta_{t} from Lemma 22 to proceed as

η4​K​S​∑k∈[K],j∈𝒮t𝜂4𝐾𝑆subscriptformulae-sequence𝑘delimited-[]𝐾𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}} 𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
≤1K𝔼[f(𝒙t−1)]−1K𝔼[f(𝒙t)]+3η𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+3​η​a2​G2S\displaystyle\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+3\eta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{3\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
+8​δK​Δt−1−8​δK​Δt8𝛿𝐾superscriptΔ𝑡18𝛿𝐾superscriptΔ𝑡\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}
+432Kδη2𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+432​K​δ​η2​a2​G2S+1K​S∑i,k144Kδη2𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+432K\delta\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{432K\delta\eta^{2}a^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}144K\delta\eta^{2}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
≤1K𝔼[f(𝒙t−1)]−1K𝔼[f(𝒙t)]+4η𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+4​η​a2​G2S\displaystyle\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]+4\eta\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{4\eta a^{2}G^{2}}{S}
+8​δKΔt−1−8​δKΔt+η6​K​S∑i,k𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\hskip 14.22636pt+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}+\frac{\eta}{6KS}\sum_{i,k}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}

The last step used the bound on the step size that η≤1864​δ​K𝜂1864𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\frac{1}{864\delta K}. Now, multiplying the error bound Lemma 23 by 96​η23​a96𝜂23𝑎\frac{96\eta}{23a} gives

96​η23​a𝔼∥𝒆t∥2≤4∗24​η23​a(1−23​a24)𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2+13​η​a​G2S+1K​S∑i,k38​K2​δ2​η3a𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2.\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{4*24\eta}{23a}(1-\tfrac{23a}{24})\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}+\frac{13\eta aG^{2}}{S}+\frac{1}{KS}\sum_{i,k}\frac{38K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{3}}{a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\,.

Adding this to the previously obtained bound yields

η4​K​S∑k∈[K],j∈𝒮t𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\frac{\eta}{4KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2} ≤(16+38​K2​δ2​η2a)ηK​S∑k∈[K],j∈𝒮t𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\leq\left(\frac{1}{6}+\frac{38K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}}{a}\right)\frac{\eta}{KS}\sum_{k\in[K],j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}
+1K​𝔼⁡[f​(𝒙t−1)]−1K​𝔼⁡[f​(𝒙t)]1𝐾𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡11𝐾𝔼𝑓superscript𝒙𝑡\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t-1})]-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]
+96​η23​a𝔼∥𝒆t−1∥2−96​η23​a𝔼∥𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t-1}\rVert^{2}-\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
+8​δK​Δt−1−8​δK​Δt8𝛿𝐾superscriptΔ𝑡18𝛿𝐾superscriptΔ𝑡\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t-1}-\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}
−1K𝔼[f(𝒙t)]−4​ηa𝔼∥𝒆t∥2\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt-\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})]-\frac{4\eta}{a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}
+(13​η​a+3​η​a2)​G2S.13𝜂𝑎3𝜂superscript𝑎2superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\hskip 28.45274pt+\left(13\eta a+3\eta a^{2}\right)\frac{G^{2}}{S}\,.

Since a≥912​η2​K2​δ2𝑎912superscript𝜂2superscript𝐾2superscript𝛿2a\geq 912\eta^{2}K^{2}\delta^{2}, we have 14−(16−38​K2​δ2​η2a)≥124141638superscript𝐾2superscript𝛿2superscript𝜂2𝑎124\frac{1}{4}-\left(\frac{1}{6}-\frac{38K^{2}\delta^{2}\eta^{2}}{a}\right)\geq\frac{1}{24}. Using this proves the lemma. ∎

G.5 Final convergence rates

Theorem V (Convergence of MimeMVR).

Let us run MimeMVR with step size η=min⁡(1L,1864​δ​K,(S​(f​(𝐱0)−f⋆)6936​K3​T​δ2​G2)1/3)𝜂1𝐿1864𝛿𝐾superscript𝑆𝑓superscript𝐱0superscript𝑓⋆6936superscript𝐾3𝑇superscript𝛿2superscript𝐺213\eta=\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K},\left(\frac{S(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{6936K^{3}T\delta^{2}G^{2}}\right)^{1/3}\right) and momentum parameter a=max⁡(1536​η2​δ2​K2,1T)𝑎1536superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾21𝑇a=\max\left(1536\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2},\frac{1}{T}\right). Then, given that ((A1)) and ((A2)) hold, we have

1K​S​T∑t∈[T]∑k∈[K]∑j∈𝒮t𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2≤𝒪((δ2​G2​FS​T2)1/3+G2S​T+(L+δ​K)​FK​T),\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq\mathcal{O}\bigg{(}\Big{(}\frac{\delta^{2}G^{2}F}{ST^{2}}\Big{)}^{1/3}+\frac{G^{2}}{ST}+\frac{(L+\delta K)F}{KT}\Big{)}\,,

where we define F:=f​(𝐱0)−f⋆assign𝐹𝑓superscript𝐱0superscript𝑓⋆F:=f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}.

Proof.

Unroll the one round progress Lemma 24 and average over T𝑇T rounds to get

1K​S​T∑t∈[T]∑k∈[K]∑j∈𝒮t𝔼∥f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2} ≤24​(Φ0−ΦT)η​T+408​a​G2S.absent24superscriptΦ0superscriptΦ𝑇𝜂𝑇408𝑎superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\leq\frac{24(\Phi^{0}-\Phi^{T})}{\eta T}+\frac{408aG^{2}}{S}\,.

Recall that we defined

Φt:=1K𝔼[f(𝒙t)−f⋆]+96​η23​a𝔼∥𝒆t∥2+8​δKΔt.\Phi^{t}:=\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{t})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{t}\rVert^{2}+\frac{8\delta}{K}\Delta^{t}\,.

Hence, ΦT≥0superscriptΦ𝑇0\Phi^{T}\geq 0. Further, note that by definition Δ0=0superscriptΔ00\Delta^{0}=0 and 𝔼∥𝒆0∥2:=𝔼∥𝒎0−∇f(𝒙0)∥2\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{e}_{0}\rVert^{2}:=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{m}^{0}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{0})\rVert^{2}. [14] show that by using time-varying step sizes, it is possible to directly control the error 𝒆0subscript𝒆0\bm{e}_{0}. Alternatively, [57] use a large initial accumulation for the momentum term. For the sake of simplicity, we will follow the latter approach. It is straightforward to extend our techniques to the time-varying step-size case as well but with additional proof complexity. Note that either way, the total complexity only changes by a factor of 2. Suppose that we run the algorithm for 2​T2𝑇2T rounds wherein for the first T𝑇T rounds, we simply compute 𝒎0=1T0​S​∑t=1T0∑j∈𝒮t∇fj​(𝒙0).superscript𝒎01subscript𝑇0𝑆superscriptsubscript𝑡1subscript𝑇0subscript𝑗superscript𝒮𝑡∇subscript𝑓𝑗superscript𝒙0\bm{m}^{0}=\frac{1}{T_{0}S}\sum_{t=1}^{T_{0}}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\nabla f_{j}(\bm{x}^{0})\,. With this, we have 𝒆0=𝔼∥𝒎0−∇f(𝒙0)∥2≤G2S​T.\bm{e}_{0}=\operatorname{\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}}\lVert\bm{m}^{0}-\nabla f(\bm{x}^{0})\rVert^{2}\leq\frac{G^{2}}{ST}\,. Thus, we have for the first round t=1𝑡1t=1

Φ0=1K𝔼[f(𝒙0)−f⋆]+96​η23​a𝔼∥𝒆0∥2≤1K𝔼[f(𝒙0)−f⋆]+96​η​G223​a​T​S.\Phi^{0}=\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta}{23a}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\bm{e}^{0}\rVert^{2}\leq\tfrac{1}{K}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}[f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}]+\frac{96\eta G^{2}}{23aTS}\,.

Together, this gives

1K​S​T∑t∈[T]∑k∈[K]∑i∈𝒮t𝔼∥f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{i\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2} ≤24​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η​K​T+96​G2a​T2​S+408​a​G2S.absent24𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝜂𝐾𝑇96superscript𝐺2𝑎superscript𝑇2𝑆408𝑎superscript𝐺2𝑆\displaystyle\leq\frac{24(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\eta KT}+\frac{96G^{2}}{aT^{2}S}+\frac{408aG^{2}}{S}\,.

The above equation holds for any choice of η≤min⁡(1L,1864​δ​K)𝜂1𝐿1864𝛿𝐾\eta\leq\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K}\right) and momentum parameter a≥912​η2​δ2​K2𝑎912superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾2a\geq 912\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}. Set the momentum parameter as

a=max⁡(912​η2​δ2​K2,1T)𝑎912superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾21𝑇a=\max\left(912\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2},\frac{1}{T}\right)

With this choice, we can simplify the rate of convergence as

24​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)η​K​T+96​G2T​S+166464​η2​δ2​K2​G2S+408​G2S​T.24𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝜂𝐾𝑇96superscript𝐺2𝑇𝑆166464superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾2superscript𝐺2𝑆408superscript𝐺2𝑆𝑇\frac{24(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{\eta KT}+\frac{96G^{2}}{TS}+\frac{166464\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2}G^{2}}{S}+\frac{408G^{2}}{ST}\,.

Now let us pick

η=min⁡(1L,1864​δ​K,(S​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)6936​K3​T​δ2​G2)1/3).𝜂1𝐿1864𝛿𝐾superscript𝑆𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆6936superscript𝐾3𝑇superscript𝛿2superscript𝐺213\eta=\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K},\left(\frac{S(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{6936K^{3}T\delta^{2}G^{2}}\right)^{1/3}\right)\,.

For this combination of step size η𝜂\eta and a𝑎a, the rate simplifies to

504​G2T​S+916​((f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)​δ2​G2S​T2)1/3+24​(L+864​δ​K)​(f​(𝒙0)−f⋆)K​T.504superscript𝐺2𝑇𝑆916superscript𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆superscript𝛿2superscript𝐺2𝑆superscript𝑇21324𝐿864𝛿𝐾𝑓superscript𝒙0superscript𝑓⋆𝐾𝑇\frac{504G^{2}}{TS}+916\left(\frac{(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})\delta^{2}G^{2}}{ST^{2}}\right)^{1/3}+\frac{24(L+864\delta K)(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{KT}\,.

This finishes the proof of the theorem. ∎

Theorem VI (Convergence of MimeLiteMVR).

Let us run MimeLiteMVR with step size η=min⁡(1L,1864​δ​K,((f​(𝐱0)−f⋆)6936​K3​T​δ2​(G2+σ2))1/3)𝜂1𝐿1864𝛿𝐾superscript𝑓superscript𝐱0superscript𝑓⋆6936superscript𝐾3𝑇superscript𝛿2superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎213\eta=\min\left(\frac{1}{L},\frac{1}{864\delta K},\left(\frac{(f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star})}{6936K^{3}T\delta^{2}(G^{2}+\sigma^{2})}\right)^{1/3}\right) and momentum parameter a=max⁡(1536​η2​δ2​K2,1T)𝑎1536superscript𝜂2superscript𝛿2superscript𝐾21𝑇a=\max\left(1536\eta^{2}\delta^{2}K^{2},\frac{1}{T}\right). Then, given that ((A1)) and ((A2*)) hold, we have

1K​S​T∑t∈[T]∑k∈[K]∑j∈𝒮t𝔼∥∇f(𝒚i,k−1t)∥2≤𝒪((δ2​(G2+σ2)​FT2)1/3+G2+σ2T+(L+δ​K)​FK​T),\displaystyle\frac{1}{KST}\sum_{t\in[T]}\sum_{k\in[K]}\sum_{j\in\mathcal{S}^{t}}\operatorname{\mathbb{E}}\lVert\nabla f(\bm{y}_{i,k-1}^{t})\rVert^{2}\leq\mathcal{O}\bigg{(}\Big{(}\frac{\delta^{2}(G^{2}+\sigma^{2})F}{T^{2}}\Big{)}^{1/3}+\frac{G^{2}+\sigma^{2}}{T}+\frac{(L+\delta K)F}{KT}\Big{)}\,,

where we define F:=f​(𝐱0)−f⋆assign𝐹𝑓superscript𝐱0superscript𝑓⋆F:=f(\bm{x}^{0})-f^{\star}.

Proof.

The proof for MimeLiteMVR is identical to that of MimeMVR, except that as noted in Lemma 18, the G2Ssuperscript𝐺2𝑆\frac{G^{2}}{S} term in Mime gets replaced by (G2+σ2)superscript𝐺2superscript𝜎2(G^{2}+\sigma^{2}) everywhere. Note that MimeLiteMVR (Lemma 18) requires a weaker Hessian variance condition of ∥∇2fi​(𝒙)−∇2f​(𝒙)∥≤δdelimited-∥∥superscript∇2subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙superscript∇2𝑓𝒙𝛿\lVert\nabla^{2}f_{i}(\bm{x})-\nabla^{2}f(\bm{x})\rVert\leq\delta as opposed to MimeMVR which needs ∥∇2fi​(𝒙;ζ)−∇2f​(𝒙)∥≤δdelimited-∥∥superscript∇2subscript𝑓𝑖𝒙𝜁superscript∇2𝑓𝒙𝛿\lVert\nabla^{2}f_{i}(\bm{x};\zeta)-\nabla^{2}f(\bm{x})\rVert\leq\delta. ∎
